title: Internal Compiler Error: add_outlives_bounds: unexpected regions

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ``` No code, just compiling crates. [dependencies] qt_widgets = "0.5.0" ``` I don't know if I can submit nightly issues. Sorry. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` note: rustc 1.70.0-nightly (ab654863c 2023-03-15) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C embed-bitcode=no note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [check_mod_item_types] checking item types in module `de` #1 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: /rustc/ab654863c3d50482f260cf862647f1fe0ff5e010\compiler\rustc_infer\src\infer\outlives\env.rs:145:26: add_outlives_bounds: unexpected regions thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/ab654863c3d50482f260cf862647f1fe0ff5e010\compiler\rustc_errors\src\lib.rs:1644:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7fffc1786c32 -
